meanings.definition: Free from blame or criticism; faultless.
meanings.sent1: Her work ethic is irreproachable, always completing tasks perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The detective's evidence was irreproachable, leading to a swift conviction.
meanings.sent3: Even the mischievous cat managed to look irreproachable after grooming.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise painted the sky in an irreproachable palette of colors.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's performance was irreproachable, leaving the audience in awe.

meanings.sent1: The chef's culinary skills were irreproachable, earning him a Michelin star.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's loyalty to his country was irreproachable, never wavering in his duty.
meanings.sent3: The robot's ability to clean was irreproachable, never missing a spot.
meanings.sent4: The singer's voice was irreproachable, hitting every note flawlessly.
meanings.sent5: The artist's attention to detail was irreproachable, capturing every nuance.
